posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Hey! Our team has run into the issue where the robot is able to follow a straight path forwards correctly but running the same path backwards causes the swerve to spin violently. I don’t understand why the swerve would be spinning so much since I put no rotation in the path at all and I don’t think it’s a characterization issue because it’s able to move straight forwards fine. Unfortunately I’m unable to share the GitHub right now but does anyone have any suggestions for what to check? Thank you!

posts.name: Devin Myers
posts.cooked: Make sure your odometer and gyro are both reading correctly, our team had a similar issue and fixing our odometry and gyro solved it.

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Ok, I will check that. Do you remember how your gyro was reading incorrectly? Were the angle readings offset? Were the angle readings in the wrong units? Was the gyro inverted? I have think our gyro readings might be inverted but I didn’t think it would matter much in a path with no rotation in the first place. Thanks!

posts.name: Devin Myers
posts.cooked: Yeah, our gyro was inverted, and because our swerve isn’t perfect it would rotate a bit, causing pathplanner to try to compensate for it, but because the gyro was inverted the angle got worse, leading to unpredictable results

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Ohhhh that makes a lot of sense. Our swerve drive is doing the same thing and I will definitely try to fix that!

posts.name: Devin Myers
posts.cooked: Could you post a link to your code on GitHub, if you don’t have it on there I would highly recommend uploading it, VSCode makes it extremely easy to do so and it is absolutely free.

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Yea sure! GitHub - DesteoyerRZSS/temporaryrepo3984 I currently don’t have access to the main repository to make it public but here’s I made a copy of the code a few days ago.

posts.name: Devin Myers
posts.cooked: I see you are putting the robot pose on a field2d, and sending it via smart dashboard. so I would just make sure it correlates with the actual robot (driving forward moves it forward, same for back left and right.) It is ok if it moves too little or too much, as long as it is roughly correct when driving slowly. Also make sure the robot rotation on the field2d is consistent with the actual robot. Btw, afaik smart dashboard does not show field2ds, so you will need to use shuffleboard. Best of luck!

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Yes, we are using shuffleboard and the translational movement was being recorded pretty accurately. The main issue is probably due to the rotation in the odometry being inverted. Thanks for your help!

posts.name: Ryan zheng
posts.cooked: Ok, thank you so much for your help. I was able to get a chance to test the path today after fixing the gyro and it works!

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
